result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert M. Vines Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
**Pay DNA surcharges.  May Not have contact with Piggly Wiggly, Robert Coronado or Mike Aldridge or their residences unless otherwise permitted by the court only.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert M. Vines Jr.

records.addlTxt: Consecutive to file 14-CM-133 left off JOC.
from 14CM133;  gb/mg
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Robert M. Vines, appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  (Court Reporter S. Armbruster)  Clerk: PT
Arguments heard on State's motion to join 14CM133 & 15CM1073 for trial and upon hearing arguments motion to join for purposes of trial is granted by the court.  DE has new charges and bond is addressed in the new file 15CF934.  Change in court reporter to Court Reporter: R. Anderson.  Case is now resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year consecutive to 14CM133.  See conditions.  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample and notice is given.  Cash Bond balance that remains in 14CM133 is to be applied and any unpaid financial obligations including DNA surcharge that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  No contact with Piggly Wiggly, R. Coronado or M. Aldridge unless permitted by the court.  Appeal Rights given.

NO RECORD TAKEN:    Attorney Margie Drees appeared for the State. Attorney David E. Celebre appearance is waived.  Clerk: PT
Atty Celebre's appearance is waived as he is ready for trial on Monday.
Demand for Discovery filed by ADA Drees

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Robert M. Vines, appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Clerk: PT
Atty Celebre states DE missed court due to transportation issues from Milwaukee.  Court vacates warrant (not yet issued) and reinstates bond.  Jury Status and Jury Trial are placed back on the court calendar and motion to join twill be heard at the Jury Status on 10/8/15 at 1PM.

Special Prosecutor K. Richard Wells appeared for the State. Attorney David E. Celebre appeared on behalf of defendant who does not appear.  Clerk: PT
Defendant fails to appear in court and Atty Celebre has no explanation for his non appearance.  Court authorizes a Bench Warrant with a $2000 Cash Bond, but will stay warrant until Monday AM at which time bond will be forfeited upon effectuating the warrant.  Jury Status and Jury Trial are canceled at the request of Atty Celebre with no objection by the State.
